# Can use this library with rtweet to generate a network graph.  This library can also write out a file in "gephi format" forwhich Gephi can open and display

```{r}
library(graphTweets)
library(rtweet)
```

## Get Tweets
```{r getTweets}
tweet_collection <- search_tweets("dukembb", n=100, lang = "en")
tweet_collection <- tweet_collection%>% 
  filter(is_retweet == FALSE)
```


## Identify Edges
```{r}
edges <- getEdges(data = tweet_collection, tweets = "text", source = "screen_name")
```

## Notes
```{r}
nodes <- getNodes(edges)
```

## prepare plot
```{r}
# plot
g <- igraph::graph.data.frame(edges, directed=TRUE, vertices = nodes)
```

## Plot
```{r}
plot(g)
```


## Dynamic Graph
```{r}
# (data = tweet_collection, tweets = "text", source = "screen_name")
dyn <- dynamise(data = tweet_collection, tweets = "text", source = "screen_name",
                start.stamp = "created_at", write=TRUE, file.dir = "rtweet")

```
